docs.snippet: After news of a police beating spread through Milwaukee, crime reports in black neighborhoods dropped precipitously....
docs.lead_paragraph: After news of a police beating spread through Milwaukee, crime reports in black neighborhoods dropped precipitously.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by sociologists Matthew Desmond and Andrew V Papachristos cites evidence showing crime spikes in period after incident of police violence because black community members become reluctant to call 911 or report crime; holds incidents destroy social contract between police and community and suppresses civic engagement; urges police departments to acknowledge their role in injustice.

headline.main: Why Don’t You Just Call the Cops?
headline.print_headline: Why Don’t You Just Call the Cops?

byline.original: By MATTHEW DESMOND and ANDREW V. PAPACHRISTOS
